title: Private-Equity Fundraising Poised to Bounce Back in 2021
sub_head: Limited partners want to invest more in the asset class after the pandemic slowed fundraising in 2020
body:
A lean year for private-equity fundraising has sharpened investorsâ€™ appetite for the asset class, and signs point to a rebound in 2021.
After years of booming fundraising for private-equity sponsors, the coronavirus brought it all to a halt, though it was short-lived. The final numbers are not in, but experts estimate 2020 fundraising will be about 25% lower than that of 2019, due mainly to the challenges of securing commitments amid travel restrictions and economic disruption.
